Key Match Events: The Padres scored six runs in the second inning against a messy Dodgers defense.
Teoscar Hernández hit a grand slam in the third inning.
David Peralta doubled down the right-field line to score two runs.
Kyle Higashioka scored a run with a fly ball.
Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a home run to deep left field.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers showed up at San Diego’s Petco Park on a cool October night brimming with confidence, riding on emotion, stung by skepticism, ready for revenge.
The Dodgers were supposed to still be furious at how the Padres had showboated their way to a Game 2 victory that incited Dodger Stadium fans into idiocy, right? Wrong.
They were supposed to defend Roberts’ honor after Padre Manny Machado threw a baseball at him in Game 2, right? Wrong.

They were tentative from the moment starter Walker Buehler was assessed a pitch-clock violation while facing Machado in the second inning, Buehler eventually struggling like all Dodger starters struggle, yielding six runs in five innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'We’ve got to win tomorrow night to then pick up the pieces for Game 5.'
Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani struck out twice and managed just one broken-bat single in a second consecutive game during which he has appeared very human.
Roberts defended Ohtani saying, 'I think that the moment is certainly not getting too big for him.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mookie Betts hit a home run in the game, which was the Dodgers' only real nice surprise of the night.
Padre Manny Machado threw a baseball at Dodgers manager Dave Roberts in Game 2.
Dodgers traded Gavin Lux to the Cincinnati Reds in wake of Hyeseong Kim signing.
